Rule.Description: If template A is present as a child, then template B is forbidden as a sibling.
If template A is present as a child of node A then template B is required as a child of node B, which is a sibling of node A. This means that the two new nodes based on template A and B are cousins.
If template A is present as a child, then template B needs to come after template A.
If template A is present anywhere in the document, template C is disallowed.
